page.title: 16Buildings around us 2
page.content: windows. There are two Semi circle steps leading to the front door. The house was built by Sir Francis Cornwall in 1680 for his wife Mary as a dower house. It was sold in 1709.It has 8 rooms including a Breakfast room, an office, 3 bedrooms, a lounge and a bathroom which still has a Victorian bath.There is an old oak staircase and the top step has a secret compartment about 10 cm by 5 cm the jewels and money were kept in it. Mr and Mrs Howorth now live in the house and before them it was Mr Walter Hewitt. The house is used as a bed and breakfast hotel and has been for 2 years. It only sleeps 2 at a time. The ground belonging to the house is about an eighth of an acre.Also an old coach house and stable.
